授業目的:
The purpose of this course is to guide students towards gaining and being able to demonstrate a critical and practical understanding of key concepts from the field of Organizational behavior (OB) in Japanese business.

A theme running through the course explores and illustrates how OB can be applied strategically towards managing and leading organizational change.
到達目標:
After working actively and collaboratively through this course, students should be able to demonstrate:

•An informed and critical understanding of key concepts from the field of Organizational Behavior.
授業方法: Instruction methods used in this course will include interactive seminars, self-assessment, group discussions, and case discussions in small groups and an entire class.  Learning in this course requires participants’ proactive participation and dedicated involvement in both class and group discussions.  Small group discussion, especially, is a key function in which to increase participants to learn throughout this course.  Thus, participants will be encouraged to share their views and ideas with other members actively.
